title: The Main Library
description:
The main library is centrally located in Fairchild Street in the heart of the main city of  Bridgetown. This location has become a temporary home since December 2008 when environmental issues forced the closure of the Carnegie Building in Coleridge Street. 
This building also houses the administrative block.  Courteous and welcoming staff,  make for a very relaxing atmosphere.  Services offered include access to EBSCO online database which contains e-books journals, newspapers and  magazines,  lending and reference services, Internet access, computer services, readersâ€™ assistance, lectures, exhibitions and displays, computer classes and photocopying services.  Story hour is held every Saturday morning from 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  Our regular hours are Monday to Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
